intro: Lobelia utshungwensis, commonly known as the Eastern Cape lobelia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Lobelia utshungwensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
